lead_paragraph: Californians used 18 percent less water in December and for a third straight month fell short of the 25 percent conservation mandate set by the governor, state officials said.

headline.print_headline: California: Optimism Despite Falling Short on Water Goal
headline.main: California: Optimism Despite Falling Short on Water Goal

snippet: Californians used 18 percent less water in December and for a third straight month fell short of the 25 percent conservation mandate set by the governor, state officials said.
abstract: California falls short of Gov Jerry Brown's 25 percent conservation mandate for third month straight; while officials say only 18 percent less water was used in December, predictions are that state's long-term conservation goal will most likely be exceeded.
